com.vaadin.addon.charts.model
Class Labels

java.lang.Object
  com.vaadin.addon.charts.model.AbstractConfigurationObject
      com.vaadin.addon.charts.model.Labels
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Labels
extends AbstractConfigurationObject

The axis labels show the numeric value or category name for each tick.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Labels

public Labels(boolean enabled)
Creates a new enabled or disabled label

Parameters:

Method Detail

getAlign

public HorizontalAlign getAlign()
Returns:
The horizontal alignment relative to the position of a label.
See Also:
setAlign(HorizontalAlign)

setAlign

public void setAlign(HorizontalAlign align)
Sets which part of the string the given position is anchored to. In inverted charts, X-axis label alignment and Y-axis alignment are swapped. Defaults to HorizontalAlign.CENTER.

Parameters:
align - the align to set

getEnabled

public boolean getEnabled()
See Also:
setEnabled(Boolean)

setEnabled

public void setEnabled(Boolean enabled)
Enable or disable the axis labels. Defaults to true.

Parameters:
enabled -

getRotation

public Object getRotation()
Returns:
The rotation of the labels in degrees.
See Also:
setRotation(Number)

setRotation

public void setRotation(Number rotation)
Sets the rotation of the labels in degrees. Defaults to 0.

Parameters:
rotation - the rotation in degrees
See Also:
#setRotation(String)

setRotationPerpendicular

public void setRotationPerpendicular()
Sets the rotation of the labels perpendicular to the axis. This is for GAUGE type charts.

getStaggerLines

public Number getStaggerLines()
See Also:
setStaggerLines(Number)

setStaggerLines

public void setStaggerLines(Number staggerLines)
The number of lines to spread the labels over to make room or tighter labels. Defaults to null. Note This applies to horizontal axes only.

Parameters:
staggerLines - the staggerLines to set

getStep

public Number getStep()
See Also:
setStep(Number)

setStep

public void setStep(Number step)
Sets whether to show only every n'th label on the axis. E.g. setting the step to 2 shows every other label. Defaults to null.

Parameters:
step - the step to set

getStyle

public Style getStyle()
See Also:
setStyle(Style)

setStyle

public void setStyle(Style style)
Sets the CSS styles for the labels. Defaults to: style: { color: '#6D869F', fontWeight: 'bold' }

Parameters:
style - the style to set

getX

public Number getX()
See Also:
setX(Number)

setX

public void setX(Number x)
Sets the X position offset of the labels relative to the tick position on the axis. Defaults to 0.

Parameters:
x -

getY

public Number getY()
See Also:
setY(Number)

setY

public void setY(Number y)
The Y position offset of the label relative to the tick position on the axis. Defaults to 0.

Parameters:
y -

getFormatter

public String getFormatter()
See Also:
setFormatter(String)

setFormatter

public void setFormatter(String formatter)
Sets a JavaScript function to format the label. The value is given by this.value. Additional properties for this are axis, chart, isFirst and isLast. Defaults to: function(){ return this.value; } If the function is a simple one liner, it can be given in a shortened form, e.g.: this.value

Parameters:
formatter -

getColor

public Color getColor()
See Also:
setColor(Color)

setColor

public void setColor(Color color)
Sets the text color for the data labels. Defaults to null.

Parameters:
color -

getConnectorColor

public Color getConnectorColor()
Returns:
The connector color or null if not defined
See Also:
setConnectorColor(Color)

setConnectorColor

public void setConnectorColor(Color connectorColor)
Sets the color of the line connecting the data label to the pie slice. The default color is the same as the point's color.

Parameters:
connectorColor -

setDistance

public void setDistance(Number distance)
Sets the distance of the data label from the pie's edge. Negative numbers put the data label on top of the pie slices. Connectors are only shown for data labels outside the pie. Defaults to 30.

Parameters:
distance -

getDistance

public Number getDistance()
See Also:
setDistance(Number)

setBackgroundColor

public void setBackgroundColor(Color backgroundColor)
Sets the background color or gradient for the data label. Defaults to undefined.

Parameters:
backgroundColor -

getBackgroundColor

public Color getBackgroundColor()
See Also:
setBackgroundColor(Color)

getFormat

public String getFormat()
Returns:
the format
See Also:
setFormat(String)

setFormat

public void setFormat(String format)
A format string for the data label. Available variables are the same as for formatter. Defaults to {y}.

Parameters:
format - the format to set
See Also:
setFormatter(String)

getSoftConnector

public Boolean getSoftConnector()
Returns:
false if connectors don't use soft arc
See Also:
setSoftConnector(Boolean)

setSoftConnector

public void setSoftConnector(Boolean softConnector)
Sets whether to render the connector as a soft arc or a line with sharp break. Defaults to true.

Parameters:
softConnector - the softConnector flag to set

getVerticalAlign

public VerticalAlign getVerticalAlign()
Returns:
the verticalAlign
See Also:
setVerticalAlign(VerticalAlign)

setVerticalAlign

public void setVerticalAlign(VerticalAlign verticalAlign)
Sets the vertical alignment of a data label. Can be one of VerticalAlign.TOP, VerticalAlign.MIDDLE or VerticalAlign.BOTTOM. The default value depends on the data, for instance in a column chart, the label is above positive values and below negative values.

Parameters:
verticalAlign - the verticalAlign to set

getInside

public Boolean getInside()
Returns:
the inside
See Also:
setInside(Boolean)

setInside

public void setInside(Boolean inside)
For points with an extent, like columns, inside property defines whether to align the data label inside the box or to the actual value point. Defaults to false in most cases, true in stacked columns.

Parameters:
inside - the explicit inside value to set
